newsitem.title: GERMANY: Analysts bullish on D.Telekom data.
newsitem.headline: Analysts bullish on D.Telekom data.

text.p: Shares in German phone giant Deutsche Telekom AG could continue their bullish trend of recent days as the market digests better-than-expected earnings figures, equities analysts said on Tuesday.
"I can imagine that shares will move in the direction of 45 marks," said Juergen Elfers, telecoms analyst with BHF Bank in Frankfurt.

"Based on what the (Deutsche Telekom chairman) Ron Sommer has said about doubling ordinary profit, we are now looking at a figure of over 13 billion marks for 1997. That means that the estimates on the market are far too low," he added.
Deutsche Telekom said earlier that 1996 group income on ordinary activities rose to 6.6 billion marks from 3.8 billion marks in 1995. Sales rose six percent to 63.1 billion marks.
In the first quarter of 1997, pre-tax profit was 2.2 billion marks, compared to 4.1 billion marks for all of 1996, and sales rose eight percent to 16.3 percent.
